titleStmt.title: William Meredith et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10624

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To His excelency Honerable Beriah Magoffin Governer of Kentucky Your petitioners would respectfully state to you that George W. Woosley of this county was fined at our last March Term of the Edmonson circuit Equity & Criminal court $20 -- for betting once on a game called chuckluck and that said Woosley is a very poor man and that he is a very p times is very poor hard and that it is impossible for him to pay said fine without making a greate sacrifice we therefore umbly beseech your honor to remit said fine by so doing you will greatly relieve said Woosley but and will much gratify your petitioner, and the community generally

Wm Meredith S E C
T B McIntire C E C C
W. Z. Z. Nash
Samuel Miller
Pleasant Goodwin
Silas.R. Jones
James Brook
Wm L
C. C. McIntire

Wm Morris
William E Curd
P J Maybaugh

George W Kimble
Will H Willimas

Edmunson Eq. Ct
$20. } Gaming
Geo W Woosley
